javaBytecodeGenerator

Class JavaClassGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.bcel.classfile.AccessFlags
      • org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen
        • javaBytecodeGenerator.JavaClassGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class JavaClassGenerator
extends org.apache.bcel.generic.ClassGen
    A Java bytecode generator. It transforms the Kitten intermediate language into Java bytecode that can be dumped to Java class files and run. It uses the BCEL library to represent Java classes and dump them on the file-system.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Builds a class generator for the given class type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JavaClassGenerator

        public JavaClassGenerator(ClassType clazz,
                          java.util.Set<ClassMemberSignature> sigs)
        Builds a class generator for the given class type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class type
        sigs - a set of class member signatures. These are those that must be translated. If this is null, all class members are translated

    • Method Detail

      • getFactory

        public final org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionFactory getFactory()
        Yields the instruction factory that can be used to create complex Java bytecodes for this class generator.
        Returns:
        the factory

      • generateJavaBytecode

        public org.apache.bcel.generic.InstructionList generateJavaBytecode(Block block)
        Generates the Java bytecode for the given block of code and for all blocks reachable from it. It calls generateJavaBytecodeFollows(Block, Map, InstructionList) and then removeRedundancies(InstructionList).
        Parameters:
        block - the code from which the generation starts
        Returns:
        the Java bytecode for block and all blocks reachable from it
